page.title: 18FARMS-CHALKS-CLAYLANE
page.content: Chalks Farm has been there several hundred years .Brian Ellis has been at the farm all his life. Everything is done by machines now but ploughing used to be done by horses pulling the plough. It is an arable farm. Machines have made farming much more efficient. Brian Ellis likes the farm a lot more with all the machines than without them. {Claylane farm. } Claylane farm used to belong to Captain Morris.There used to be a dairy herd there but Captain Morris sold it off to Hancocks.Before he sold it Mr Hancock used to be the cowman.The Dairy Herd used to have about 150 cows in.Hancocks building yard has now taken over Claylane Farm and has made one house into offices.
